page.title: 05FARMING CONTINUED
page.content: The farmer breeds his own replacement cattle. Surplus cattle are sold at auction and fetch Â£400. The main pests on the farm are warble flies. Garside Farm is the largest in the area covering 108 acres. The farmhouse dates back to 1697 and the present family has lived there for 100 years. The{livestock}consists of 80 Hereford and Fresian cattle, ducks, hens and a few peacocks. Ellenroad Farm is a small farm covering only 40-50 acres. The farmhouse was originally built in 1733 The farmer has a few milking cows and some beef cattle. He breeds his own animals. There are foxes in the area which sometimes cause him problems.
